doc:
Francis X. Bushman Jr. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_X._Bushman_Jr. 0 Ralph Everly Bushman (May 1, 1903 – April 16, 1978), was an American actor. He appeared in fifty-five films between 1920 and 1943. In his early film career, he was often credited as Francis X. Bushman Jr. The son of notable silent film star Francis X. Bushman and Josephine Fladung Duval, he was born in Baltimore, Maryland and died in Los Angeles, California at age 74. He was a maternal uncle of Pat Conway (1931–1981), star of the ABC western television series Tombstone Territory (1957–1960). He and his wife Beatrice were married for 54 years at the time of his death. Ralph_Everly_Bushman ( May_1_,_1903 – April_16_,_1978 ) , was an_American_actor . He appeared in fifty-five_films between 1920_and_1943 . In his_early_film_career , he was_often_credited as Francis_X._Bushman_Jr . The_son of notable_silent_film_star_Francis_X._Bushman and Josephine_Fladung_Duval , he was_born in Baltimore , Maryland and died in Los_Angeles , California at age_74 . He was a_maternal_uncle of Pat_Conway_(_1931 – 1981_) , star of the_ABC_western_television_series_Tombstone_Territory_(_1957 – 1960_) . He and his_wife_Beatrice were_married for 54_years at the_time of his_death .
